title: Tea garden near bhimtal
review: It was a surprise visit to a tea garden in this part of the Himalayan ranges. Has it's own kumaoni charm.

title: Tea Garden near Nainital visited by @GhumantuBaba
review: Ghorakhal Tea Factory is just 3 kms from Bhowali, 12 kms from Bhimtal and 15 kms from Nainital.

title: Small and well maintained tea garden
review: Surprise to see tea gardens in Uttarakhand. Nicely and newly maintained tea gardens offers a photography spot to tourists. good Experience for those who are viewing tea gardens for the first time.

title: Small and sweet Tea Factory
review: Good for those who never visited team garden. Very good information as they explain the process of making varieties of tea, very informative if you are going with your kids. A place for photo enthusiasts.

title: cool tea factory
review: nice and sweet enviroment works are very hardworking and creative must visit and tea also have superior quality

title: A place flr Photography
review: A place you can suit pics and snapshot.

title: Good for those who never visited team garden
review: Very good information as they explain the process of making varieties of tea, very informative if you are going with your kids. A place for photo enthusiasts.

title: Organic Tea amid beautiful nature
review: It is a mid sized tea garden estate near sainik school ghorakhal. Well maintained. Require only 30 min of time to explore and experience. You can buy organic tea of 2 or 3 qualities, click photographs etc. Entrance fee is charged 20 INR per head.

title: Nothing much!
review: It's like any other tea garden spread over huge area but only two small gardens are open for visitors.  It does have few good picturesque spots to click pictures but other than that it has nothing to offer.  We thought there must be a tea stall at least,  so we hiked a little to this place (you can also go by car) but unfortunately it's just a tea factory and tea gardens. They charge INR 20 per person for visiting the tea gardens,  nothing much to do or see though. So yeah, if you are in nainital and give it a miss you won't be taking any #FOMO back home. So yeah, that's it.

title: no worth!!
review: This is over hyped.nothing much to see here.

title: Charming & Photogenic lush green orchid
review: It was surprise being there. Enjoyed green and green all around. Kids danced to the tunes of wind in Little lanes between tree plants. Do buy one heritage wooden packing of tea from factory outlet. They don't allow to visit factory premises.

title: tea garden you must see and buy tea
review: i was there 2 years ago. It was garden. Bit there was nobody to show you round. There is retails outlet and purchased black And green tea. Both are excellent. But you dont find it in market and have not found to buy it again. Been a Govt organization, they do seem to be well organised in marking its products.

title: A nice experience for North Indians..
review: There are very few tea plantations in North India and this is one among those. A very nice idea of a tea plantations combined with the fact that it is easily accessible and enroute to. Mukteshwar..

title: Lush green infinite garden
review: This Tea garden is very beautiful, you can get lost in green and can click really awesome pictures.

title: One of it's kind
review: There are only 2 tea gardens in Uttarakhand. Gorakhal Tea Factory is located in Bhowali and is easily accessible from Ramgarh / Bhimtal.

title: Must Visit for  a tea lover
review: This is  a very nice place to visit if you love tea. Absolute greenery and very well maintained. They wont take you through the process but its for you to explore the green garden midst the tea plantation.

title: Only for First Timer if not seen tea plantation
review: Near by Bhimtal . Can visit if never seen tea plantation . A small Tea plantation, No one there to guide you. A small Tea processing unit is also there. But they don't allow to visit factory premises.. There is a outlet selling the Black Tea and Green Tea. but costly.

title: A quick 15 min halt
review: Nothing special....it's a small, well kept tea garden with a few photo opps. There's an outlet selling the garden's tea. Entry ticket Rs 20

title: Not worth visiting
review: Owned by the Government and not meant for a tourist visit. We only saw few tea plants and were not shown how the tea is made in the factory. Non touristy place!

title: Small Tea Garden
review: Its a small tea garden where you can stopby for some nice clicks if you are going towards Mukteshwar from Nainital. If you like organic tea, then you can buy it fresh from here as less as 100 gms.

title: Not worth it
review: About 2 kms from the Ghorakhal temple is the tea garden.  When we went the tea leaves were not very healthy (looked diseased).

title: Visit only if you have not seen a Tea Estate
review: Located in very peaceful environment is a Tea Estate and Factory producing organic himalayan tea. Apart from view of Tea Gardens and buying organic tea, there is nothing much to do.

title: Small and sweet Tea factory with tea estate
review: There's an outlet selling the garden's tea. Entry ticket Rs 20.  Near by Gorkhel temple and Bhimtal. A small Tea plantation and small Tea processing unit is also there. But they don't allow to visit factory premises. Owned by the Government and not meant for a tourist visit.

title: Picturesque Tea Gardens
review: At first I was not knowing that there is tea plantation in Uttarakhand. On the way to Mukteshwar Dham from Nainital my taxi driver suggested me to visit these Tea Gardens.  I really thank him for his suggestion as this is a very nice place. You can step down into the tea gardens and enjoy walking in and taking pictures. The pictures are amazing and I recommend photography here. But mind your feet because there are pits that are not visible if you wandering.

title: Lovely
review: Discovered this place on last day so was pleasantly surprised.  Weather played a great part .. n nice open fields of tea with easy access.. son was so happy .. exteriors are flanked with its flagship store selling what else ? But tea leaves .

title: Good Garden of tea
review: Its a good garden situated near the NANDIN BABA ASRAM near the UNA COMFORT MISTY OAKS HOTEL not so far from the bhowali approx 03 km from bhowali x crossing to ramgarh road its a realy place to buy a natural tea and you can also see the how can they make a tea from t tree.i love that garden.

title: Nice place to walk around Bhowali
review: We went there for a walk from within the villages in Bhowali.

title: An unusual site seeing in Kumaon
review: Personally I liked this place but I came to know that generally visitors tend to compare it with commercial tea estates of Munnar or Ooty or Darjeeling end up finding it a ' no point visiting' place. In fact, there is no point comparing those century old private commercial tea estates to this tea garden recently established under  'government wage guarantee scheme' . Visit to this place can be recommend only if

title: Best Himalayan tea outside Darjeeling
review: We stopped by this tea garden at Bhowali without any expectations. I frankly had no clue that Uttarakhand even grew tea. And coming from Bengal, the home of Darjeeling Tea, a certain snobbishness about all tea is part of my mental makeup. But all that was about to change.The tea garden is quite beautiful and well maintained though not very large. It was obvious that the State cared for this industry. There is a shop attached to the garden, and we they had 2 varieties, priced at a modest Rs. 400 and Rs. 600 per kg. We bought 250 gm of the higher priced one, and the lady at the shop very humbly told us that it requires 3-5 mins brewing, like its Darjeeling originals and may not be able to support addition of milk. We packed it away among our various souvenirs. The biggest surprise was when I actually made tea out of this back home. This tea gave out a beautiful aroma akin to the GI coded Darjeeling, and can take a wee drop of milk. The colour is towards grey and not the gold associated with Darjeeling but that is the only variance. Excellent Himalayan tea, and I would recommend a "must buy" if you are a tea lover.

title: Organic small tea estate in Ghorakhal
review: This is a 100% organic tea estate run by uttarakhand govt. Being totally chemical free garden aims to preserve the soil and environmental by their zero contamination policy. Lush green, spread on the foothills of shivalik mountains with frequent visits by groups of langoors (monkeys). This cute little tea garden gives tourists a close encounter with the workings of the tea plantation.

title: Lush green...!!!
review: I really fell in love with the tea plantations, the pattern of plantation is just amazing , it is mesmerising, I really felt the taste of nature, the tea leaves are directly sourced from plantations and are sourced here, the product obtained is soo fresh, they retail the produced products , I purchased some exotic tea varieties along with green tea.. it is one among the must visit places in nainital...!!!

title: Visit if u ve not been to a tea garden
review: It is nice for the first time visitors to see  and experience the tea garden. We did enjoy the surrounding. Few min drive from Gulu temple. You have the stall too. Do purchase  the full leaf tea for green tea. It is really good. Had few great snaps and kids loved to walk though the maze.
